document.masterDocTitle: A review of New World Laemophloeus Dejean (Coleoptera: Laemophloeidae): 2. Neotropical species with antennal club of three antennomeres

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of New World Laemophloeus Dejean (Coleoptera: Laemophloeidae): 2. Neotropical species with antennal club of three antennomeres

materialsCitation.collectorName: J. E. Eger & L. B. & C. W. O'Brien & C. W. O'Brien

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype male, deposited in FSCA , with following label data: “ BRAZIL : Rondonia , 62km . SW Ariquemes , near Fzda Rancho Grande ,
8-20-XI-1994
, J.E.Eger , L.B.&C.W. O’Brien , blacklight trap ” allotype female, deposited in FSCA , with following label data: “ BRAZIL : Rondonia , 62km . SW Ariquemes , Fzda. Rancho Grande
15-XI-1994
, C.W. O’Brien uv trap ”.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description: 2.5mm long; elongate-ovate; dorsal and ventral surfaces testaceous; mandibles darker distally; legs slightly paler.

Thorax: 1.7× wider than long; widest at about apical third; 1.3× wider at apical third than across basal angles; anterior angles slightly produced, obtuse; hind angles slightly produced, obtuse; antebasal denticle distinct ( Fig. 60 ); sublateral line with a median dark spot but without median fovea; punctation and pubescence similar to head; surface smooth and shiny between punctures, not microreticulate. Legs moderate; femora stout.

Elytra: 1.5× longer than wide; inner margin of cell 1 distinctly basally and apically, middle third represented by a row of punctures, outer margin obsolete, inner margins of cell 2 completely grooved, outer margin obsolete; cell 3 complete; humeral carina well-marked; discal surface with lines of minute punctures, no discernable pubescence.

Female allotype :
2.0mm long; head 2.4× wider than long; eye 0.7× length of head; antennae attaining base of pronotum; median epistomal emargination broad and shallow, angles not produced, mandibular and antennal emarginations absent; pronotum 1.5× wider than long; elytra 1.7× longer than wide.
Variation: Paratypes range in length from 1.4mm to 3.4mm .

Paratypes .

. Paratypes deposited in BMNH, DEFS, FSCA, MNHN, MNKM, and USNM.
Etymology. The specific epithet is the Latin noun for “bull,” referring to the long epistomal horns.

Discussion. The peculiar pubescence character of the club antennomeres is shared only with
L. lecontei
, which also possesses epistomal horns in the male and a similar form of genitalia.
